Post.title: gitNote
Post.author: SmalBox
Post._content:
# Git command note

## Install: initialize user name and user email.

``` bash
$ git config --global user.name "Your Name"
$ git config --global user.email "email@example.com"
```

## 1.Create git

``` bash
$ mkdir learnBox //
$ cd learnBox //
$ pwd //
$ git init //.gitls -ah
```

## 2.Add & Commit file

``` bash
$ git add readme.txt //
$ git commit -m "add readme.txt" //
```

## 3.Check the status & difference

``` bash
$ git status //
$ git diff readme.txt //
$ git log //
$ git log --pretty=oneline //
```

## 4.Reset

``` bash
$ git reset --hard HEAD^ // '^' '~100'100
$ git reset --hard <version id> //git
$ git reflog //
```

## 5.Stage(index)

``` bash
 "git add" stage
 "git commit" stage
```
## 6.Manage modify

``` bash
addstagecommit
$ git diff HEAD -- readme.txt //
```

## 7.Undo changes

``` bash
1)addcommit
	$ git checkout -- <file>
2)addcommit
	$ git reset HEAD <file>
	$ git checkout -- <file>
3)addcommit
	$ git reset --hard HEAD^//
```
	
## 8.Remove file

``` bash
$ rm <file> //
$ git rm <file> //
$ git checkout -- <file> //
```


## Remote repository

``` bash
$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "email@example.com" //ssh
//GitHubssh key 
```

## 9.Add and remove remote repository =

``` bash
$ git remote add origin https://github.com/SmalBox/learngit.git
$ git remote add origin git@github.com:SmalBox/learngit.git
//GitHub.
$ git remote rm <remote name> //
$ git push -u origin master //GitHub
```

## 10.Clone from remote repository

``` bash
$ git clone git@github.com:SmalBox/repositoryName.git //
```

## Manage branch

## 11.Create & Combine branch

``` bash
$ git branch //
$ git branch <name> //
$ git checkout <name> //
$ git checkout -b <name> //
$ git merge <name> //
$ git branch -d <name> //
$ git branch -D <name> //
```

``` bash
$ git checkout -b dev // dev
$ git branch // 
$ git checkout master // master
$ git merge dev //dev  master
$ git branch -d dev // dev
```

## 12.Conflict fixed

``` bash
//
//addcommit
$ git log --graph --pretty=oneline --addrev-commit //
```
	
## 13.Branch strategy

``` bash
$ git merge --no-ff -m "merge with no-ff" dev //Fast
forwardcommit
```

## 14.Bug branch(Stach)

``` bash
$ git stash //
$ git stash list //
$ git stash pop //stach
$ git stash apply stash@{0} //stash0
$ git stash drop //stash
```

## 15.Collaboration

``` bash
$ git remote //(name)
$ git remote -v //
$ git push <git name> <branch name> // git push origin master
$ git checkout -b dev origin/dev //devdev
$ git pull //
$ git git  branch --set-upstream-to=<remote name>/<branch name> //
```

## 16.Tag

``` bash
$ git tag <name> //,commit
$ git tag //
$ git tag <name> <commit id> //commit
$ git tag -a <tag name> -m "description" <commit id> //
$ git tag -s <tag name> -m "description" <commit id> //
$ git show <tag name> //
$ git tag -d <tag name> //
$ git push <remote name> <tag name> //
$ git push <remote name> --tags //
//
$ git tag -d <tag name> //
$ git push <remote name> :refs/tags/<tag name> //
```

## 17.Alias

``` bash
$ git config --global alias.co checkout //
$ git config --global alias.st status 
$ git config --global alias.ci commit
$ git config --global alias.br branch
$ git config --global alias.lol "log --pretty=oneline"
$ git config --global alias.glol "log --graph --pretty=oneline --abbrev-commit"
//.gitconfig.gitconfig
```

$ git config --global user.name "Your Name"
$ git config --global user.email "email@example.com"

1.Create git

$ mkdir learnBox //
$ cd learnBox //
$ pwd //

2.Add & Commit file

$ git commit -m "add readme.txt" //

3.Check the status & difference

$ git log //

4.Reset

$ git reset --hard <version id> //git
$ git reflog //

5.Stage(index)

 "git add" stage
 "git commit" stage

6.Manage modify

addstagecommit
$ git diff HEAD -- readme.txt //

7.Undo changes

1)addcommit
    $ git checkout -- <file>
2)addcommit
    $ git reset HEAD <file>
    $ git checkout -- <file>
3)addcommit
    $ git reset --hard HEAD^//

8.Remove file

$ rm <file> //

$ git checkout -- <file> //

Remote repository

$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "email@example.com" //ssh
//GitHubssh key

9.Add and remove remote repository =

//GitHub.
$ git remote rm <remote name> //
$ git push -u origin master //GitHub

10.Clone from remote repository

$ git clone git@github.com:SmalBox/repositoryName.git //

Manage branch

11.Create & Combine branch

$ git branch -d <name> //
$ git branch -D <name> //

$ git checkout -b dev // dev
$ git branch // 
$ git checkout master // master
$ git merge dev //dev  master
$ git branch -d dev // dev

12.Conflict fixed

//
//addcommit
$ git log --graph --pretty=oneline --addrev-commit //

13.Branch strategy

$ git merge --no-ff -m "merge with no-ff" dev //Fast
forwardcommit

14.Bug branch(Stach)

$ git stash //

15.Collaboration

$ git checkout -b dev origin/dev //devdev

//
$ git tag -d <tag name> //
$ git push <remote name> :refs/tags/<tag name> //

17.Alias

$ git config --global alias.co checkout //
$ git config --global alias.st status 
$ git config --global alias.ci commit
$ git config --global alias.br branch
$ git config --global alias.lol "log --pretty=oneline"
$ git config --global alias.glol "log --graph --pretty=oneline --abbrev-commit"

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)
